bertelsbank.rest

extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestResource

        public RestResource()
        The constructor which initializes the Class-Logger.

    • Method Detail

      • getAccount

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAccount(java.lang.String number)
        Returns an account object with all its transactions if the number provided by the client belongs to an existing account. Otherwise an error message will be returned.
        Parameters:
        number - the account number of the account which should be returned
        Returns:
        the response to the HTTP-get. In best case it will be the desired account object or a HTTP status with error information.

      • executeTransaction

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response executeTransaction(java.lang.String senderNumber,
                                                    java.lang.String receiverNumber,
                                                    java.lang.String amount,
                                                    java.lang.String reference)
        Receives the information for a transaction and checks if the transaction is viable. If not, an error response will be returned. Otherwise the transaction will be triggered.
        Parameters:
        senderNumber - the account number of the sender.
        receiverNumber - the account number of the receiver.
        amount - the value which is to send from the sender account to the receiver account.
        reference - a short text which explains the reason of the transaction.
        Returns:
        a HTTP response which shows if the transaction was done or not. If the transaction was not possible, an error message explains the cause.

      • addAccount

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addAccount(java.lang.String accountNumber,
                                            java.lang.String owner,
                                            java.lang.String startBalance)
        Checks if a new account can be created and triggers the execution.
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - the number of the account which should be created.
        owner - the name of the person the account will belong to.
        startBalance - the amount of money which will be transferred to the account immediately after creation.
        Returns:
        a HTTP response will declare if the creation of the account was successful or not.

      • getAllAccounts

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAllAccounts()
        Provides a collection of all accounts which belongs to the Bertelsbank.
        Returns:
        array containing all account objects with the respective transactions.

      • getAllTransactions

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAllTransactions()
        Provides all transactions executed within the Bertelsbank.
        Returns:
        array containing all Transaction objects.

      • updateOwner

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateOwner(java.lang.String number,
                                             java.lang.String owner)
        Receives form-URL-encoded parameters to update the owner name of a specific account.
        Parameters:
        number - specifies the account which is to be updated.
        owner - provides the new owner name which will replace the former owner name.
        Returns:
        HTTP response which returns the status of the task.

      • getFreeNumber

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getFreeNumber()
        When a new account is to be created this method provides a free number which can be used as the account number.
        Returns:
        HTTP response containing the free number as a string (plain text) or the HTTP error message.

      • recallNumberReservation

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response recallNumberReservation(java.lang.String number)
        The method "getFreeNumber" provides a free number to create a new account. If the creation is canceled and the new account will not be created, the number will again be made usable for the next new account.
        Parameters:
        number - contains the number which is to be declared as free again.
        Returns:
        HTTP response with HTTP statuscode 200.

      • getAccountBalance

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAccountBalance(java.lang.String number)
        Provides the balance for a specific account.
        Parameters:
        number - identifies the account.
        Returns:
        HTTP return containing the calculated account balance or an error message.

      • resetDatabaseTables

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response resetDatabaseTables()
        Resets the database tables to a standard scenario with a bank account and 4 customer accounts. Each one of the customer accounts will start with a balance of 10,000.
        Returns:
        HTTP response.
